summary: This is an email from defense attorneys to Judge Alison J. Nathan, submitting Ghislaine Maxwell's response to the government's notice regarding her Rule 17 subpoenas. The document is being submitted directly to the court under a protective order before being filed publicly.

persons.name: Nicole Simmons
persons.context: Attorney from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. who sent the email submitting Maxwell's response to the court.

persons.name: Nathan NYSD Chambers
persons.context: Recipient of the email, referring to Judge Alison J. Nathan's chambers.

persons.name: Jeff Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email, also from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Laura Menninger
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email, part of Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Bobbi Sternheim
persons.context: Attorney copied on the email, part of Maxwell's defense team.

persons.name: Jeffrey S. Pagliuca
persons.context: Attorney who signed the formal submission letter, from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The defendant in the case (U.S. v. Maxwell), whose response to government subpoenas is being submitted.

connections.description: Pagliuca is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys submitting legal documents on her behalf.
Simmons is one of Maxwell's defense attorneys handling correspondence with the court.
Both are attorneys at Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. working on Maxwell's defense team.
Maxwell is the defendant in the case being presided over by Judge Nathan.

events.title: Government's Notice Regarding Subpoenas
events.description: The government filed a notice regarding Ghislaine Maxwell's Rule 17 subpoenas.

events.title: Maxwell's Response Submission
events.description: Maxwell's defense team submits her response to the government's April 5 notice regarding Rule 17 subpoenas directly to the court.

keyFacts: Ghislaine Maxwell's defense team is submitting a response to government subpoenas under a protective order.
The document reveals Maxwell's defense attorneys are from Haddon, Morgan and Foreman, P.C. in Denver, Colorado.
The case is U.S. v. Maxwell, Case No. 20 Cr. 330 (AJN), presided over by Judge Alison J. Nathan.
The defense is following special procedures for information covered by a protective order before public filing.
The correspondence shows ongoing legal proceedings regarding Rule 17 subpoenas in Maxwell's case.
